nodes.documentation:
@notice clearInventory clears the inventory of a product.
@dev decrementInventory verifies inventory levels, whereas this method
simply sets the inventory to zero. This is useful, for example, if an
owner wants to take a product off the market quickly. There could be a
race condition with decrementInventory where a product is sold, which could
cause the admins decrement to fail (because it may try to decrement more
than available).
  * @param _productId - the product id

clearInventory(uint256).details: decrementInventory verifies inventory levels, whereas this method simply sets the inventory to zero. This is useful, for example, if an owner wants to take a product off the market quickly. There could be a race condition with decrementInventory where a product is sold, which could cause the admins decrement to fail (because it may try to decrement more than available).

costForProductCycles(uint256,uint256).details: If a product is a subscription, the interval defines the period of time, in seconds, users can subscribe for. E.g. 1 month or 1 year. _numCycles is the number of these intervals we want to use in the calculation of the price.   * We require that the end user send precisely the amount required (instead of dealing with excess refunds). This method is public so that clients can read the exact amount our contract expects to receive.

params._numCycles: - the number of cycles to calculate for

params._initialInventoryQuantity: - the initial inventory (inventory can be changed)
params._initialPrice: - the starting price (price can be changed)
params._productId: - the id of the product to use (cannot be changed)
params._supply: - the total supply - use `0` for "unlimited" (cannot be changed)

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

isSubscriptionProduct(uint256).details: Some products are subscriptions and others are not. An interval of 0 means the product is not a subscription

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

availableInventoryOf(uint256).notice: The available inventory of a product

clearInventory(uint256).notice: clearInventory clears the inventory of a product.

costForProductCycles(uint256,uint256).notice: returns the total cost to renew a product for a number of cycles

createProduct(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.notice: createProduct creates a new product in the system

decrementInventory(uint256,uint256).notice: decrementInventory removes inventory levels for a product

incrementInventory(uint256,uint256).notice: incrementInventory - increments the inventory of a product

intervalOf(uint256).notice: The renewal interval of a product in seconds

isSubscriptionProduct(uint256).notice: returns if this product is a subscription or not

productInfo(uint256).notice: The product info for a product

setPrice(uint256,uint256).notice: setPrice - sets the price of a product

setRenewable(uint256,bool).notice: setRenewable - sets if a product is renewable

totalSold(uint256).notice: The total sold of a product

totalSupplyOf(uint256).notice: The total supply of a product

userdoc.notice: LicenseInventory controls the products and inventory for those products*
